intro: Notholaena buchtienii, commonly known as the Buchtien's fern, is a rare and delicate species native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its finely divided, leathery fronds that form a dense, compact rosette. The plant produces small, spore-bearing sporangia on the underside of its leaves, typical of ferns. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
